results.title: Game Masters: Blizzard Entertainment interview
results.brief_description:
Blizzard Entertainment is a world leading developer and publisher renowned for creating some of the industry’s most critically acclaimed games. Blizzard’s first success was in 1994 with ‘Warcraft: Orcs and Humans’, a game that laid the foundations for the burgeoning real-time strategy genre, introducing gameplay features that would become standards. In 1996 the company released the action-role-playing-game ‘Diablo’. With a track record that includes thirteen number one games and multiple Game of the Year awards, Blizzard Entertainment has gone on to establish one of the largest online followings of any game company worldwide.

The company is best known for the subscription-based massively multiplayer online role-playing games ‘World of Warcraft’ (2004), and ‘StarCraft’ (1998) series. NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Shaun Gladwell: Stereo Sequences interviews [web excerpt]
results.creator_credit: Jason White, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘Shaun Gladwell: Stereo Sequences’ is the first in the ‘New Horizons’ series of ACMI commissions. Gladwell uses filmic devices such as slow-motion and long pans to capture both tightly choreographed and improvised performances by breakdancers, skateboarders and BMX bike riders in a combination of rural and city settings. The resulting works, which he describes as “performative landscapes” are both rhythmic and poetic - distorting speed, gravity, space and time; exploring visual and spatial paradoxes. He discusses his art practice and his collaboration with other performers and artists for this exhibition. Other interviews include; Sarah Tutton (ACMI curator), Josh Raymond (Gladwell producer) Vivienne Wong (Australian Ballet) and Lamaroc (street dancer).

results.title: Jeff Lindsay in conversation with Sue Turnbull: Dark Tales, Serial Archetypes [web excerpt]
results.brief_description:
Jeff Lindsay, author and creator of our favourite serial killer ‘Dexter’, is joined in conversation with Professor Sue Turnbull, as they explore the renaissance of macabre fairytales in popular culture.

Jeff Lindsay and Sue Turnbull touch on many of the themes covered in the ‘Fairytales Re-imagined’ symposium, providing a fascinatingly insightful discussion centred around the development of fairy tale motifs in popular culture. In this web excerpt, Lindsay focuses on cannibalism, the theme of his most recent installment ‘Dexter is delicious’. He explores it’s origins in fairy tales and the proliferation of cannibalism through online forums.

results.title: Lella Smith interview with Emma McRae [excerpt]
results.brief_description: Lella Smith is the Creative Director of the Walt Disney Animation and Research Library and curator of the ‘Dreams Come True: The Art of Disney’s Classic Fairytales’ exhibition. In this interview, Emma McRae, ACMI Exhibitions Curator, speaks to Lella about how the exhibition came about and the enormous task of selecting the films and items for exhibition from Disney’s vast archives.
results.description: Lella Smith is the Creative Director of the Walt Disney Animation and Research Library and curator of the ‘Dreams Come True: The Art of Disney’s Classic Fairytales’ exhibition. results.title: Glen Keane interview with Emma McRae [excerpt]
results.brief_description: Glen Keane has been with the Walt Disney Studios for over 25 years and is best known for his character animations for feature films such as: ‘The Little Mermaid’, ‘Aladdin’, ‘Beauty and the Beast’, ‘Tarzan’, and ‘Tangled’. In this interview, Emma McRae, ACMI Exhibitions Curator, speaks to Glen about his never-ending passion for drawing, what inspires him to create such unforgettable characters as The Beast and Ariel. Glen also talks about the changes in animation from hand drawn to digital.

results.title: 'At the movies': Tim Burton masterclass with Margaret Pomeranz
results.brief_description: Hosted by Margaret Pomeranz, this masterclass reveals the workings behind Tim Burton’s creative genius, offering insight into his creative process with a rare view into his world of melancholic misfits, gothic suburbia and contemporary fairytales.

results.title: In conversation with Bill Viola: Melbourne International Arts Festival 2010
results.brief_description:
In October 2010, renowned American artist Bill Viola travelled to Melbourne to install two exhibitions of his work : ‘The Raft’ at ACMI and ‘Fire Woman and Tristan’s Ascension’ at St Carthage’s Catholic Church in Parkville. Presented by ACMI along with Melbourne International Arts Festival and Kaldor Public Art Projects, these two exhibitions gave Melbourne audiences a unique chance to experience the work of one of the world’s more influential and important artists.

Viola has been instrumental in the establishment of video as a vital form of contemporary art. For over 40 years he has created videotapes, architectural video installations, sound environments, electronic music performances, flat panel video pieces and works for television broadcast. His video installations – total environments that envelop the viewer in image and sound – employ state-of-the-art technologies and are distinguished by their precision and direct simplicity.

In this film Bill Viola is in conversation with Rachel Kohn, Producer and Presenter of ‘The Spirit of things’ and ‘The Ark’ on Radio National.

results.title: Tim Burton @ ACMI : Highlights of Tim Burton's visit to ACMI
results.brief_description: This is a highlights package of Tim Burton’s time at ACMI. It showcases the events that Tim Burton participated in as well as the peripheral activities that occurred around the Exhibition set up and launch. A celebration of Tim Burton and the exhibition, it includes footage of Tim Burton meeting with the young tour guides, book signings, the masses that filled Federation Square to see the sold out event of Tim Burton’s Masterclass, Burton Club, Media Launch, Official Opening as well behind the scenes footage of installations such as the BatMobile and Balloon Boy.

results.title: Tim Burton official opening : Tim Burton : the exhibition
results.brief_description: This film highlights the excitement and celebration of the official opening of ‘Tim Burton: the exhibition’. A night filled with colour and sound. Amongst the fire eaters, stilt walkers and burlesque performers were the Tim Burton fans waiting to get a glimpse of their idol. The festivities start with the red carpet for VIPs that ran along the Flinders Street entrance and eventually inside ACMI’s Lightwell the official opening speeches were delivered.

results.title: Screen Worlds opening : September 2009
results.brief_description:
On Thursday September 17, 2009 ACMI’s new permanent screen culture exhibition Screen Worlds, was officially launched. The red carpet, VIP event attracted world wide attention with the attendance of both internationally recognised and home grown guests and artists. Kicking off the formalities was ACMI’s Board President, John Thwaites, followed by ACMI Director Tony Sweeney, Oscar® Winning Actress Cate Blanchett, Victorian Arts Minister Lynne Kosky and Victorian Premier John Brumby.
Following this, the ribbon is cut and guests enter the exhibition for the first time.
